column4: yeah I have the package on my computer and its going batty when it tries to configure it
make sure to clear out your .wine folder also when changing wine versions
should I just delete it?
if you don't have any programs installed that you NEED to keep in there yes
wine has been in beta forever, it hasn't had a "stable" release yet
yeah no kiddin. 0.9.50 still has some major problems though. Steam doesn't work right with it yet
hence the continuous term of "beta"

it's an extremely ambitious program, that also depends on how well written the program you're trying to run is programmed. It's incredible enough as it is, I can run wow and warIII with no issues, I love it :)
I just did what you said, and now the program that i choose to install it with (wine doors) is crapping out on me
you're installing wine with winedoors?
or wine doors is crapping out with the wine from the ubuntu repos?
yeah, it was just easier at the time
if you're dealing with a wine from winedoors or ANYWHERE other than the ubuntu repos you need to go to them and ask, even if you are it's probably good to ask the wine people
it still grabs wine from the ubuntu repos
and does other stuff
all it does is prompts the install of wine and comes with the configuration tool (wine doors)
it just makes it easier to install stuff
well passed clearing your home dir I don't have any ideas why you're app isn't working
*and by that I mean clearing the .wine folder of course, not your whole home dir
well, sudo apt-get remove wine again right? and I'll try deleting .wine again
i tried to reinstall steam from my installer and its giving me a wierd cryptic error
I already said I don't have any more ideas for you, esp with steam as I have never used it (or ever will)
